Author: scoobee99
Content: At the time we started http://www.indiahacker.com, http://www.reddit.com/r/india wasn't a very active community. Perhaps people tend to focus on top-level domains and less so on subreddits (my theory).

Author: scoobee99
Content: Indeed, it is based on reddit source! ('Powered by reddit') :-)

Author: scoobee99
Content: Thanks. The intention is to be India specific, but not necessarily 'hacker kinda news'. The clean and minimal UI is inspired by HN.

Title: Ruby Isn't Just for Tuesday Anymore, or Big Doings with Little Languages

Author: thenextweb

Author: brandnewlow
Content: I've never taken a mathematic approach to playing Monopoly.  Having played many a game over the years, victory always goes to however makes the best property/money trade during the game.  The middle of Monopoly games inevitably involve people swapping cards for cash and vice/versa.  Whoever gets the best end of a deal at the end of these trades usually wins.
